content:
Meet the new traditionalists

ON A street of soot-stained sandstone, tucked behind Scotland’s National Museum, a door is thrown open and then pulled shut against the cold. A snatch of sound—lass="word-wrap-span">chatter, strings and the strum of a lass="word-wrap-span">guitar—hints at what cannot be seen through the fogged-up pub window. Inside, past the crowd of patrons, a group of young musicians lass="word-wrap-span">huddles around a table and let music fly from their fingers. 

There has been great interest in Scotland’s traditional arts in the 20 years since the creation of the country’s lass="word-wrap-span">dlass="word-wrap-span">evolved lass="word-wrap-span">Parliament and the lass="word-wrap-span">folk-music scene, in particular, is thriving. Across the country at least 23,000 people have taken up the craft in schools, community bands and through education organisations such as Feis Rois and Feisean nan Gaidheal; more than 17,000 of the pupils are under the age of 18. Although government funding for lass="word-wrap-span">folk music lags behind that given to opera and classical fare, Hands up for Trad, an lass="word-wrap-span">advocacy group, and Creative Scotland, a public-funding body, have helped nurture a wealth of talent.

Many enjoy the results at lass="word-wrap-span">gigs and as part of the lass="word-wrap-span">informal session culture, in which musicians play with peers in a pub for tips (and perhaps a free pint). Over the course of a generation, the lass="word-wrap-span">appetite for such music has grown to sustain 53 separate record companies and to merit lass="word-wrap-span">dedicated lass="word-wrap-span">Festivals such as HebCelt lass="word-wrap-span">Fest in Stornoway. This year lass="word-wrap-span">Celtic Connections, an annual lass="word-wrap-span">celebration in Glasgow, will welcome more than 100,000 people.

Traditional music is often bound up with nationalist sentiment, but this new generation of musicians—unlike those involved in the lass="word-wrap-span">folk revival of the 1960s—do not make political messages the focus of their work. Young artists were raised in a different environment, in communities that do not depend upon one (often struggling) trade or industry, and they do not yearn for a forgotten past. Politics may loom in the background in these troubled times, but artists are more intent on using traditional music to get people dancing. 

Though they still rely on the beloved lass="word-wrap-span">bagpipes and lass="word-wrap-span">fiddles, they add reverb, synth and crystalliser pedals to loop effects and create depth. Talisk is one band giving Scottish lass="word-wrap-span">folk a sleek new sound and appearance. They invest in PR, slick videos and lass="word-wrap-span">flashy lighting to transform their Scottish-Irish sound into a spectacle suitable for lass="word-wrap-span">gig-goers in countries like Malaysia, lass="word-wrap-span">Chile and the lass="word-wrap-span">Philippines. Mohsen Amini plays the lass="word-wrap-span">concertina in the band but spends his free time experimenting with technology like multi-sample pads with expression pedals. This, he reckons, will help the group add subtle new layers to its music, key to success on the international stage where “every single person is pushing the boundaries”. The most successful bands have notched up millions of streams and sold tens of thousands of tickets. Tide Lines, a lass="word-wrap-span">folk/pop/rock quartet from the lass="word-wrap-span">Highlands, released an EP which entered the British iTunes class="word-wrap-span">harts in the top ten. The tunes of Elephant Sessions, an indie-lass="word-wrap-span">folk group also from the lass="word-wrap-span">Highlands, have been streamed in 78 countries.

All this contributes to cultural tourism in Scotland: half of visitors from outside Britain list the local arts among their reasons for making the trip. Many outsiders come to wonder at the wild of the lass="word-wrap-span">Highlands or to seek the clichéd lass="word-wrap-span">Caledonia of the screen—“Braveheart”, “lass="word-wrap-span">Outlander” and the Hogwarts Express ploughing across the Glenfinnan lass="word-wrap-span">Viaduct—but spend time and money in pubs, restaurants and hotels, where music sets the mood. Some lass="word-wrap-span">entrepreneurial spirits, such as those at Skippinish lass="word-wrap-span">Ceilidh House in Oban, have already lass="word-wrap-span">harnessed their skills to offer commercially successful lass="word-wrap-span">Ceilidh nights where visitors can learn how to dance. lass="word-wrap-span">Tacked onto the end of a tourist trail, that offers them a sense of “lass="word-wrap-span">authentic” culture. Some believe Scotland could take this business further and better lass="word-wrap-span">emulate its lass="word-wrap-span">Celtic cousins in Ireland who have, for decades, championed and capitalised on the concept of craic . “In Ireland, they have based their cultural tourism strategy on the music. We are just getting to the point in Scotland where we are confident to say ‘this is our music, and it’s quite good fun too’,” says Simon McKerrell, a Scottish lecturer in music at lass="word-wrap-span">Newcastle University. 

Some lass="word-wrap-span">heritage-sector workers fear that too much focus on tourism and commercial success risks sentimentalising and reducing Scotland’s rich musical soundscape to stereotypes. That seems unlikely. The current crop of players is well-schooled in the Strathspeys, lass="word-wrap-span">jigs, reels and lass="word-wrap-span">laments that form the nation’s musical lass="word-wrap-span">heritage but want to bring the experience to a new, modern audience. Mr Amini argues that it is possible to be both respectful and lass="word-wrap-span">experimental with the lass="word-wrap-span">genre. “You lass="word-wrap-span">absolutely don’t want to lose your lass="word-wrap-span">integrity,” he says. “But tradition is always evolving.”

ex: n. 〈诗〉苏格兰；卡列多尼亚
网络 加勒多尼亚；喀里多尼亚；苏格兰忆昔
n. 同乐会
eg2: The Scottish  (pronounced KAY-lee) began as a gathering where people shared music and told stories.
苏格兰同乐会（发音棋利）开始是聚集在那里的人共同享着音乐和讲故事。
, a kind of dancing party with folk music. Typical Scottish folk dances include jigs, reels and "the Gay Gordons".
“同乐会”是一种以民间音乐为伴奏乐的舞会。典型的苏格兰民间舞蹈包括快步舞、里尔舞和“快乐戈登”舞。
The cute animal sound effects will keep you amused and the folk music of the Monster Ceilidh Band will keep your feet tapping.
可爱的动物的声音效果将让你逗乐，让你的脚攻的的怪物同乐会乐队的民间音乐。

ex: n. 智利

eg2: Whether you like blues or rock, Cajun, folk, Zydeco, country, or of course, all that jazz, you are guaranteed to hear it at Jazz .
无论你是喜欢蓝调或是摇滚、卡杨、民族、柴迪科、乡村音乐，或是当然还有所有的爵士乐，保证你会在“爵士风”听到它们。
April Fool's Day thus developed into an international fun , so to speak, with different nationalities specializing in their own brand of humor at the expense of their friends and families.
因此愚人节最终发展成了一个国际化的开玩笑的节日，可以说，各个国家的人都有他们专门的方式来捉弄他们的朋友和家人。
Only 10 days ago, US defence officials described their dialogue with China as a love-  .
仅10多天前，美国国防官员还将与中国的对话形容为是“友好和值得称赞的”。

eg2: The German parliament is called the ‘Bundestag’.
德国的议会称为 Bundestag。
a Member of Parliament
议会议员
The issue was debated in Parliament .
议会就这个问题进行了辩论。
an Act of Parliament
议会法案
to win a seat in Parliament
赢得议会中的一个席位
to be elected to Parliament
当选为议会议员

我们现已进入了本届议会的后半任期。
to dissolve Parliament(= formally end its activities) and call an election
解散议会并举行大选

ex: adj. 菲律宾的；菲律宾人的

eg2: CMMI certification, she says, would ensure a higher quality of software development and help Philippine software companies compete more effectively, particularly in the international market.
她说，CMMI认证将确保更高质量的软件开发，帮助菲律宾的软件公司，特别是在国际市场上，更有效地竞争。
Among the outstanding questions is whether victims were killed by Mendoza's or Philippine police bullets during the botched rescue operation and how the negotiation process was carried out.
在蹩脚的救援行动期间，遇难者是死于门多萨还是菲律宾警方的子弹，以及他们到底怎样进行的谈判，这些问题到现在依然是个迷。

wp.absolutely stunning: 绝对的美丽;绝对让人叹为观止

ex: adv. 绝对地；完全地
eg2: I confide  in his honesty.
我绝对信任他的忠实可靠。
If you , positively need to see massive improvement in a month or a year, what do you have to do to turn your world around?
如果你绝对积极地需要在一个月或者一年内看到大的改进，那么你需要怎么做才能使你的世界变个样子？
This should go without saying, but I’ll include it within this point,  do not plagiarize .
有一点不言自明，但是我还是要在这里说一下：那就是，绝对不要剽窃。

ex: n. 主张；拥护；辩护
n. 食欲；嗜好
eg2: These dishes can quicken your .
这些菜肴能刺激你的食欲。
The smell from the garbage dulled her .
闻到来自垃圾的臭味使她食欲大减。
With the increasing of the age, the  would slough.
随着年龄的增长，人的食欲就会减弱。

wp.authentic self: 真实自我;本真的自我;真实我;活出真我
wp.authentic text: 正本;真确本;自然性的话语;原创性的书篇

ex: adj. 真正的，真实的；可信的
eg2: I see them longing and reaching out for authentic community.
我看到他们渴望并向可信的集体张开双臂。
People who participate feel like they know me, because my heart, my  self, my gratitude, is all up in this thing.
那些参与活动的人们感到他们认识我，因为我的心，真实的自我，我的感恩，全都投入在这件事情上。
God created you and so He wants you to be the real you. By being authentic when you speak to God, you worship Him as your Creator.
是神创造了你，他想要你活出真正的你。你与神交谈时要作真实的你，你要敬拜神，真的把他看为你的创造者。

国界
county boundaries
郡界
boundary changes/disputes
边界变化╱争端
The fence marks the boundary between my property and hers.
那道篱笆是我和她的住宅之间的分界。
Scientists continue to push back the boundaries of human knowledge.
科学家不断扩大人类知识的范围。
the boundary between acceptable and unacceptable behaviour
可接受和不可接受的行为之间的分界线

ex: n. 同乐会

, a kind of dancing party with folk music. Typical Scottish folk dances include jigs, reels and "the Gay Gordons".

eg2: They have painted the city up for the .
他们为了庆祝会已把该市油漆一新。
Does she accept to hostess my birthday ?
她答应作我生日庆祝的女主持了吗?
The interest of all the students converged upon the .
全体学生的兴趣都集中于庆祝会。

ex: vi. 唠叨；喋喋不休；（动物等）吱吱叫

wp.continual chatter: 不断聊天者;不断颤振;不断数落

eg2: He turned off as she kept up her .
她喋喋不休时，他没有去听。
We expect the din of the cloud-related chatter to turn into a real roar by this time next year.
我们期望云相关的喋喋不休的喧闹在明年的这个时候变成真正的咆哮。
I couldn't have guessed then, drifting to sleep to the sound of their amiable , that every last one of them was a terrorist.
在他们和蔼可亲的唠叨声中，我终于进入了梦乡。 当时的我怎么也不会想到——其实这些人都是恐怖分子。

ex: n. 六角手风琴

网络 六角风琴；风琴类乐器；蛇腹形铁丝网
eg2: The truck crashed into the tree and concertinaed.
货车撞在树上撞扁了。

wp.Dedicate Server: 独享服务器;专用服务器

ex: vt. 致力；献身；题献
eg2: She vowed to herself that she would  her life to scientific studies.
她默默地发誓要献身于科学研究。
They take ownership of compatibility issues we raise and  effort to seeing them through.
他们具有我们所说的兼容性问题，并且正致力于解决这些问题。
As young people search for meaning in their lives, their minds are often open to all possible choices about what to believe, how to live, and what—if anything—to  themselves to.
当年轻人探索他们的生命意义时，他们的心灵往往向一切可能的选择敞开，像是关于信仰什么，如何生活，以及——如果一定要这样说的话——为了什么而献身。

ex: vi. 被移交；转让
vt. 转移；移交；使滚下；衰落
eg2: These arguments relate little, if at all, to the business problem at hand and tend to  into pedantic arguments of semantics.
这些争论根本与手头的业务问题关系甚微，如果有的话也非常少，并退化为书生气十足的语义学争论。
David Cameron is sticking to his plans to  more power to those directly delivering the services, cut out bureaucratic middle men and enhance competition.
卡梅隆坚持自己的计划，即把更多权力移交给这些直接服务的机构，裁减打官腔的中间人员，加强竞争。

ex: vt. 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
n. 仿真；仿效
eg2: Employees look to you to show them the behaviors that they should .
员工希望你为他们表现出他们应当模仿的行为举止。
Developers want to understand these people,  them, and listen to their ideas.
开发员想要理解这群人，模仿他们，并听取他们的意见。
Observe them.  them.
观察他们，模仿他们。

eg2: Designs . We know this to be true from experience.
设计在发展，我通过经验了解到这一点。
So the mystery is starting to clear around how diverse species with an array of features .
所以围绕着拥有一系列特性的不同物种是怎么进化的谜团开始变得清晰。
But this paper is an interesting step forward in exploring what forced us to .
在到底是什么迫使我们进化的探索中此篇论文迈出了有趣的一步。

eg2: The  farm is near the waterpower station.
实验农场靠近水电站。
So , if you want to find out these rates, you can measure their equilibrium concentrations.
那么从实验的角度，如果你想找出这些速率，你可以测量它们的平衡浓度。
But there is some evidence that for some people homosexual experiences may well be part of a transitional or experimental phase in their youth.
但是有证明显示对于一些人，同性经历很可能是他们青年时期过渡阶段或是实验阶段的一部分。

ex: n. 调整；摆弄；欺诈；骗钱行为
v. 伪造；不停摆弄；篡改；对…做手脚
int. 同“fiddle sticks”
网络 小提琴；民族提琴；拉提琴
eg2: He was fiddling with his keys while he talked to me.
和我谈话时他不停地摆弄钥匙。
to fiddle the accounts
篡改账目
She fiddled the books(= changed a company's financial records) while working as an accountant.
她当会计时对账簿做了手脚。
an insurance/tax, etc. fiddle
保险、纳税等骗局

ex: adj. 闪光的；瞬间的；俗丽的；暴躁的

wp.FLASHY PASSES: 花哨传球趋向;闪电;花式传球

eg2: Not only had these flashy computer systems failed to forecast behaviour in, say, the subprime mortgage world, but they had also seduced bankers and investors to take foolhardy risks.
这些华而不实的计算机系统不仅未能预测到，比方说，次贷领域的行为，而且还引诱银行家与投资者承担不明智的风险。
The reason that non-profits need help, they say, is they they’re often cost constrained – or if they’re not, they get criticized for spending a lot of money on flashy websites.
非赢利组织需要帮助的原因是，正如他们说道，他们经常被强制消费-即使没有，他们也因在一些花哨的网站上花了太多的钱而频遭指责。
If he can afford a car, a  one is better than a boring one.
如果他能买一辆车，华丽的总比乏味的更适合他的胃口。

wp.Folk Festivities: 民间习俗;官方风俗;民间节日

wp.folk guitar: 民谣吉他;民间吉他;民谣弹唱;民谣吉他民谣吉他

wp.folk crafts: 民间工艺品;工艺品厂;平易近间工艺品;民间手工艺
wp.folk psychology: 民间心理学;民族心理学;		民俗心理学;大众心理学

eg2: I hope it doesn't stain the carpet.
希望它别把地毯弄脏。
This carpet stains easily.
这块地毯不耐脏。
The juice from the berries stained their fingers red.
浆果汁把他们的手指染成了红色。
to stain wood
给木料上色
Stain the specimen before looking at it under the microscope.
先把标本染色，再放到显微镜下观察。
They stained the floors dark brown.
他们把地板涂成了深棕色。
The events had stained the city's reputation unfairly.
这些事件使该市背上了不应有的恶名。
a blood/a coffee/an ink, etc. stain
血迹、咖啡渍、墨痕等
stubborn stains(= that are very difficult to remove)
顽固的污渍
How can I get this stain out?
我怎么才能把这点污渍除去？
The carpet has been treated so that it is stain-resistant(= it does not stain easily) .
这地毯已经过处理，不易挂污。

ex: n. 刻板印象；模式化观念（或形象）；老一套
adj. 固定不变的；陈规旧套的；铅板(印刷)的
v. 对…形成模式化（或类型化）的看法
网络 老套；定型；成见
eg2: cultural/gender/racial stereotypes
有关文化的╱性别的╱种族的旧框框
He doesn't conform to the usual stereotype of the businessman with a dark suit and briefcase.
他不同于人们一般印象中穿黑色西装、提公文包的商人形象。
Children from certain backgrounds tend to be stereotyped by their teachers.
教师往往模式化地根据学生的某些背景把他们归类。
Why are professors stereotyped as absent-minded?
为什么在人们心目中教授就一定健忘呢？

ex: n. 胡乱弹的声音
v. 弹奏（吉他等乐器）
网络 扫弦；乱奏；滤板
eg2: As she sang she strummed on a guitar.
她边唱边弹吉他。

ex: adj. 微妙的；精细的；敏感的；狡猾的；稀薄的
eg2: What I wanted did not belong to me by right and whilst it could not be refused tome in quite same way, we still have  punishments for anyone who insists on what they are and what they want.
我所想要的，并不理当属于我，而虽然它也不能以完全同样的方式拒我于外，但是任何人若坚持要做某种人或是想要某些东西，我们仍然会给他很微妙的惩罚。
The answer might be as  as how you made eye contact or where you were standing.
或许是因为你们的眼神接触或者是你所站的位置，这些微妙的动作所影响的。
They’re great for easily adding lots of interest and depth to a design, whether it be a huge background pattern or just some subtle textures here and there.
它们实在太棒了，无论是一幅巨大的背景图案还是只有一些精细的纹理，都能轻易地为设计处处增添不少吸引力与深度。

ex: adj. 适当的；相配的

wp.Suitable material: 适用材料;适合材料;典型物料;适用原料
wp.suitable pinky: 合适的小指;适合张文慈;适用于小指
wp.Suitable applications: 适合应用;适合应用闭环

eg2: They have pitched upon the most suitable man for the job.
他们已选好最适当的人来做那项工作。
The diet should be , being neither too rich nor too meagre.
饮食应该适当， 既不能太油腻也不能太粗淡。
The local shops have been marked in on this map so that people can choose a house in a suitable area.
这张地图已将当地的一些商店增加进去，这样人们就能在适当的地区内选择住所。

wp.sustain circuit: 保持电路;		吸持电路;维持电路

ex: vt. 维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实
eg2: The pillars sustain the roof of the pit.
坑道顶用柱子支撑着。
How long will you sustain the rudeness of your boss?
对你上司的粗暴无礼你还能忍受多久?
Wants, or desires, are things we would like to have but they do not sustain us.
想法或愿望，是我们想要拥有的东西但是他们不能维持我们的生活。

wp.to thrive: 繁荣兴旺;大量生长;要一举超越;使兴旺

ex: vi. 繁荣，兴旺；茁壮成长
eg2: A business cannot thrive without good management.
企业没有良好的管理不会兴旺。
And I want every child to have the same chances to learn and dream and grow and  that you girls have.
我同时也希望每一个孩子都能拥有跟你们一样的学习机会，同样充满梦想，然后茁壮成长起来。
If you are yourself at work, you will either  or wither, and if you wither chances are that you are in the wrong place to begin with.
如果你在工作中坚持做自己，你要么茁壮成长，要么逐渐枯萎，当你枯萎的时候，还会有机会在你枯萎的错误地方重新开始。

ex: adj. 扔掉的
v. throw(扔、投掷)的过去分词
网络 投掷武器；抛；投掷类
n. 传统主义者；因循守旧者
adj. 传统主义者的（等于traditionalistic）
v. 跟踪；追踪；（被）拖；磨蹭
n. 小径；路径；踪迹；足迹
网络 痕迹；轨迹；小路
eg2: a trail of blood
一连串血迹
tourists who leave a trail of litter everywhere they go
一路乱丢垃圾的游客
The hurricane left a trail of destruction behind it.
飓风过后满目疮痍。
The hounds were following the fox's trail.
猎犬追踪着狐狸的气味。
The police are still on the trail of the escaped prisoner.
警方仍在追捕逃犯。
Fortunately the trail was still warm(= clear and easy to follow) .
庆幸的是痕迹仍然清晰可循。
The trail had gone cold .
臭迹已经消失了。
a trail through the forest
穿过森林的小路
a tourist trail(= of famous buildings)
游览路线
politicians on the campaign trail(= travelling around to attract support)
进行巡回宣传的政治人物
A jeep trailing a cloud of dust was speeding in my direction.
一辆吉普车拖着一股扬尘，朝我疾驰而来。
I trailed my hand in the water as the boat moved along.
我把手放在水里，让小船拖着往前划行。
The bride's dress trailed behind her.
新娘的结婚礼服拖在身后。
The kids trailed around after us while we shopped for clothes.
我们在商店买衣服时，孩子们无精打采地跟在后面。
United were trailing 2–0 at half-time.
联队在上半场结束时以 0:2 落后。
We were trailing by five points.
我们落后五分。
This country is still trailing badly in scientific research.
这个国家在科研方面仍然大大滞后。
The Conservatives are trailing Labour in the opinion polls.
在民意测验中保守党的支持率落后于工党。
The police trailed Dale for days.
警方跟踪了戴尔多日。
trailing plants
蔓生植物
He had tears trailing down his cheeks.
他的眼泪顺着双颊流了下来。

ex: vt. 卷起；挤进；用某物舒适地裹住；使有褶裥；收拢；大口吃；使隐藏
n. 食物；船尾突出部；缝摺；抱膝式跳水；活力；鼓声
vi. 缝褶裥；缩拢；舒服地裹在里面；大口吃
n. (Tuck)人名；(东南亚国家华语)德；(英)塔克

wp.Tuck rib: 集圈罗纹;集圈罗纹针织物;集圈罗纹编织
wp.Tuck Net: 抄网;小网兜;追逐网;翻译
wp.Amos Tuck: 艾默斯杜克学院;商学院;街道地址

eg2: You can also tuck disposable heat packets into your mittens.
你也可以在手套里塞上一些一次性的热袋。
Read a story to your kids and sing to them when you tuck them in at night.
打你夜晚抱起你的孩子哄他入睡的时候，给他讲个故事或是唱一首歌
Stretch the top of your head toward the ceiling, and  your chin in slightly.
头向上抬起，头顶与天花板保持平行，并将下颌稍稍向内收拢。

wp.yearn for: 渴望;向往;非常想念;盼愿

ex: vi. 渴望，向往；思念，想念；怀念
eg2: The man who has everything is in some way is a poor man. He will never know what it feels like to , to hope, to nourish his soul with the dream of something better.
一个拥有一切的人在某些方面也是个穷人，他永远不会知道什么是渴望、什么是期待；永远不知道用渴求更美好的东西来充实他的灵魂。
Yet we all  for that deep connection with others, those moments of bliss, joy, completeness.
然而，我们都渴望与别人深入的交往, 渴望那些幸福、快乐、圆满的时刻。
There is nothing mysterious about this; in every aspect of life, we  for things to be regular and parallel.
这点没有任何神秘的；生活中的每一方面，我们都渴望事物是有规律和对等的。

Title: Why Scottish folk music is thriving
